result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pedro L. Mendoza

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pedro L. Mendoza in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Pedro L. Mendoza.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant plead guilty to count #1. Upon motion of the State count #2  dismissed and read-in. Motion granted. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor prohibited pursuant to Sec. 941.291. PSI ordered. Minutes filed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Pedro L. Mendoza in court.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Pedro L. Mendoza.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wants to take offer from State. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Pedro L. Mendoza in court, in custody. Future dates remain. Minutes filed.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:05 PM (64-06) Defendant Pedro L. Mendoza appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Pedro L. Mendoza.  Attorney Samuel Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Kuehn acknowledges receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Attorney Kuehn states there may be a possible special plea.




adj. 2:10
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Pedro L. Mendoza appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Attorney Christopher Kuehn in court for the Defendant. Called @ 1:31 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF375, AIA on 21CF578, 21CF674, and statuses on remaining files - 21CF34, 20CM550, 20CM112, and 20CM26. Record by Atty. Kuehn as to status of competency. They will not be contesting the findings that defendant is competent to proceed. Court addresses Mr. Mendoza who responds to Court's questions regarding competency report. 
Record by Atty. Kuehn as to initial appearance in 22CF375 and adjourned initial appearances on 21CF578 & 21CF674. Atty. requests preliminary hearing on these matters with other files to track. Court sets as requested.
Record by the State who would have no objection to the bond in previous files covering the new felony with the added condition of "NO CONTACT WITH C.E."   Court grants state's request as to bond. 
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 22GF714 (22-448), 21CF674, 21CF578, 21CF34, 20CM26, 20CM112 & 20CM550
NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH CORRECTIONAL OFFICER ESPINOZA "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney Chris Kuehn. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
